      • Prim

        public Prim​(Graph graph)
        Creates an instance of the class. Requires a graph to apply the algorithm to.

    • Method Detail

      • minVal

        public static int minVal​(boolean[] visited,
                         int[] weights)
        Chooses the shortest path to the next node if it has not been visited yet.
        Parameters:
        visited - Boolean Array representing the visited nodes
        weights - Integer Array representing the weights of the graph's edges
        Returns:
        Vertex with the minimum weight from the set of Vertices

      • prim

        public int[] prim()
        Applies Prim's algorithm to a graph. This will result in the Minimum Spanning Tree of the graph. A Minimum Spanning Tree is a representation of the graph including only the minimum weight arcs.
        Parameters:
        graph - Graph to apply Prim's algorithm on
        Returns:
        Integer Array representing the Minimum Spanning Tree

      • makeTree

        public Tree makeTree​(int[] nodes)
        Constructs the Minimum Spanning Tree used to evaluate the shortest circuit in the graph.
        Parameters:
        nodes - Array containing the Minimum Spanning Tree
        Returns:
        Minimum Spanning Tree

      • printMST

        public void printMST​(int[] res)
        Prints the connection between nodes in the Minimum Spanning Tree and their respective weights.
        Parameters:
        graph - Graph to be evaluated
        res - Integer Array representing the Minimum Spanning Tree
